data.meta_description: Horses and riders from Roman mosaic from Libya Strabo, in ''Geography'' book XVII, wrote on Numidian/Libyan Horse and the various tribes that rode or used horses in Numidia/Lubia :      ''Their horsemen are mostly with a javelin, using bridles made of rush, and riding bareback; but they also carry daggers... the Libyans in general, dress alike and are similar in all other respects, using horses that are small but swift, and so ready to obey that they are governed with a small rod.
